intro: Lomatium triternatum var. platycarpum, commonly known as the broad-fruited lomatium, is a perennial herb native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in umbels, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its distinctive feature is the broad, flat fruits that develop from the flower clusters, giving it its varietal name. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
